<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Time Mage Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3839) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 184</row>

**Archetype** [Time Mage](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=191)

**Prerequisites**
You have a spellcasting class feature.

</column>

---

You might be a novice in the temporal arts now, but in the future, you'll hold time in the palm of your hand. As some of your future knowledge leaks back to your present self, you gain the [_delay consequence_](/Spells.aspx?ID=622) domain spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell. This feat grants a focus pool of 1 Focus Point that you can recover by using the [Refocus](/Actions.aspx?ID=71) activity to revisit moments from your past and contemplate futures yet to come. If you already knew _delay consequence_ from a feat or ability that allows you to gain your choice of domain spell, such as [Domain Initiate](/Feats.aspx?ID=265), then when you take this feat, you can retrain that option to gain a different domain spell instead as your personal timeline rearranges itself. You also gain [_time sense_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1193) as an innate cantrip usable at will. This innate spell and your focus spells from the time mage archetype are of the same tradition as the spells you used to meet the archetype's prerequisites.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the time mage archetype.

<title level="2">Time Mage Dedication leads to...</title>
[Chronocognizance](/Feats.aspx?ID=3840), [Chronomancer's Secrets](/Feats.aspx?ID=3841), [Future Spell Learning](/Feats.aspx?ID=3842), [Into the Future](/Feats.aspx?ID=3844), [Purge of Moments](/Feats.aspx?ID=3845), [Timeline-Splitting Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=3846), [What Could Have Been](/Feats.aspx?ID=3843)
